FuncDef:
The l2-multicast ipv6 source-lifetime command sets the aging time for (S, G) entries of multicast traffic in a specified VLAN/VSI.
The undo l2-multicast ipv6 source-lifetime command restores the default setting.
By default, the aging time is 210s for (S, G) entries of multicast traffic in a specified VLAN.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the aging time for (S, G) entries of multicast traffic in a specified VLAN/VSI.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 1000, in seconds. The default value is 210.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a multicast source no longer sends multicast data flows, the source needs to be deleted. This requires constant probes on whether the source sends multicast data flows, deteriorating system performance. To address this problem, run the l2-multicast ipv6 source-lifetime command to set the aging time for entries of multicast traffic in a specified VLAN/VSI.
